alert.note: Alert for Buffalo; Clark; Jackson; Taylor; Trempealeau (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 02 at 6:09PM CST until January 03 at 6:00PM CST by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: .The incoming winter storm will cause precipitation to break out across the area. The precipitation is expected to start developing from mid to late this evening and expand in coverage overnight. Initially, the precipitation should be light snow or a wintry mix before changing to a wintry mix for most of the area overnight. Expect some snow and ice accumulations to occur before warmer air moves in Tuesday for most of the area to change over to rain. The highest impacts and amounts of ice or snow are expected from late tonight through Tuesday morning. The Tuesday morning commute will be impacted. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 9 PM THIS EVENING TO 6 PM CST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Mixed precipitation expected. Total snow accumulations of up to one inch and ice accumulations of one tenth to two tenths of an inch. * WHERE...Portions of north central and northeast Iowa, southeast Minnesota and central, north central and west central Wisconsin. * WHEN...From 9 PM this evening to 6 PM CST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. In Iowa, visit 511ia.org for road conditions. In Minnesota, visit 511mn.org for road conditions. In Wisconsin, visit 511wi.gov for road conditions.
